title: On National Security | Space Force and commercial industry taking relationship to the next level
summary: The U.S. Space Force is exploring the creation of a space equivalent of the civil reserve air fleet, or CRAF, a program the Pentagon conceived 70 years ago to gain access to commercial airlift capacity in an emergency.

title: Industry sees missed opportunity in deorbiting ISS
summary: NASA’s plan to spend up to $1 billion on a tug to deorbit the International Space Station is a missed opportunity to instead repurpose or recycle the station, some in industry argue.

title: TLP Network Announces First Mission To Lunar Surface
summary: LunEx-1 is the first mission to the moon as part of TLP Network's LunEx (Lunar Exploration) program.

title: U.S. Space Force budget includes $60 million for ‘tactically responsive space’
summary: The U.S. Space Force in budget documents submitted to Congress last week is seeking $60 million over the next two years for a program known as tactically responsive space

title: GMV partnership to bring revolutionary precise positioning services to Australia and New Zealand
summary: These days, satellite positioning systems play a fundamental role in our society. We are constantly surrounded by this technology, and it has been fully integrated into our lives. It has multiple applications, and its potential uses continue to expand into a wide variety of industries such as communications, security, and transportation. In fact, it has […]
